attributes.action: distribute the £116m fine imposed on the major supermarkets directly back to the dairy farmers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Office of Fair Trading has imposed fines totalling almost £116m on major supermarkets and milk suppliers as a result of price fixing.  Supermarkets claim in their defence that they were trying to ensure a fair price for the farmers.  According to the National Farmers Union of Scotland, however, "not much of the money had gone to the farmers".  The dairy farming industry is in a desperate state and it is proposed, therefore,  that the £116m in fines to be levied by the OFT be distributed pro rata and in full among all the dairy farmers in the United Kingdom.
